page.title: 08COAL MINING(2)-GALSTON
page.content: Today the number has diminished greatly and those employed in the industry have to travel outwith the town to Mauchline,Sorn and Prestwick. The most recent coal mine opened in 1984 this being an open-cast mine due to close in 6 months time in 1986.But it ran out of coal so quickly because of the demand for coal during the miners strike.During this period the mine did not close because the workers were not members of the NUM.The coal was being distributed to all over Scotland as well as some of England. The pit was only 30 acres in size and 135 meters above sea level.The over-burden of slate ,boulderclay and Calciferous Sandstone,has been replaced and levelled for re-seeding with grass.
